formatDescription:
The documents (files) created by Adobe Illustrator are PostScript language
documents. A PostScript language document description that minimally conforms to the Document Structuring Conventions has two main parts: a prolog and a script. The prolog encapsulates information needed by other programs to interpret the file. The script describes the graphic elements on the page.
provenanceCompoundName: Georgia Tech Research Institute / Georgia Tech Research Institute
formatProvenance:
Specification available at http://mercator.elte.hu/~saman/hu/okt/AI7FileFormat.pdf
Adobe has classified Illustrator Versions 5.0 and 5.5 as the same file format.
Version 5.0 includes layers and live editing in preview mode
Version 5.5 includes spell checker, find/replace text

internalSignatures.name: Adobe Illustrator 5.0
internalSignatures.note: The first line of the file declares that the file contains a Postscript program and identifies the version of the Document Structuring Conventions to which the document conforms as 3.0. The comment “%AI5_FileFormat 1” indicates that this is a version 5.x file.
